oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Opportunities and Responsibilities for Rapid Detection Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MacDonald, Alexander
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rapid detection systems
animal health
food supply
drug residues
contaminants
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The opportunities for rapid detection systems in the area of animal health products primarily revolve around those associated with the food supply, in particular, raw meat products. The reason for the method opportunities are the consumer's concern and their awareness for meat that is free of violative residues of veterinary drugs and other chemical contaminants such as pesticides, industrial chemicals, and to a much lesser degree, natural toxins.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: AAVPT Biennial Symposia; Sixth Biennial Symposium; 33-35
